result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: 15CF93

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with his mother unless with her consent and agent's approval.
Domestic abuse counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: To defendant, request denied.
From defendant received 5/9/16 requesting Huber privileges.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED consecutive to 15CF93 Stayed for 2 years Probation concurrent to 15CF93 - Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with his mother unless with her consent and agent's approval. Domestic violence counseling.
Sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 3,  Court finds defendant guilty. Counsels requests a separate date for sentencing. State to comply with victims rights. Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was just appointed as successor counsel and requests an adjournment and just received discovery. State advises this matter might resolve. Court will put the matter (15CF93) back on the jury status/jury trial. Files 15CM350 and 15CM138 to trail along.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is not ready to enter a plea today and requests a jury status/jury trial date on 15CF93. 15CM138 and 15CM350 to trail along on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states they are working on a global resolution and requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's newest case addressed. These cases will all be resolved. Defense requests another date.  Court will give another date in 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Prior: 720 Scott Ave #1, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to have no contact with any co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Steven A Ray in court with attorney Beth Weathers for Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
